meanings.definition: The state or quality of being well-known or recognized.
meanings.sent1: Her notedness in the community made her a popular figure.
meanings.sent2: The notedness of the singer attracted a large audience to the concert.
meanings.sent3: Despite her notedness, she remained humble and approachable.
meanings.sent4: The notedness of the landmark could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The notedness of the author's work spread far and wide.

meanings.definition: The act of taking notice or paying attention to something.
meanings.sent1: His notedness of the small details impressed his boss.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's notedness in class helped students stay focused.
meanings.sent3: The notedness of the squirrel's acrobatics entertained the park visitors.
meanings.sent4: The notedness of the detective's keen observation skills solved the case.
meanings.sent5: The notedness of the scientist's discovery revolutionized the field.
